docs.title: Anti aliasing
docs.text: Anti-aliasing smooths jagged lines/edges.

docs.title: Chromatic Abberation
docs.text:
Chromatic Abberation is a type of color distortion caused by the offset of RGB channels.

Parameters

Abberation method - Type of CA Red offset - Offset of channel R Green offset - Offset of channel G Blue offset - Offset of channel B Distortion factor - Multiplier offset of all channels

docs.title: Grain
docs.text: Randomly generated noise

docs.title: Letterbox
docs.text: Black bars below and above an image

docs.title: About Equinox
docs.text:
Equinox is a modular, multimedia application created in TouchDesigner, designed for real-time compositing, VJ-ing and audioreactive performances. Equinox implements a comprehensive workflow and interface that makes VJ-ing easier and more accessible for artists.

Equinox is a sole developer project still in alpha development.

Equinox, alpha v1.0.0.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Master effects chain - Equinox has a library of effects that can be inserted into the master effects chain. These effects can be rearranged and edited.
  • Media compositor - Equinox has an integrated, multimedia compositor with adjustable decks and columns that mixes clips with the main signal. Each deck has its own designated effects chain, allowing for modular, creative experimentation.
  • Grading suite - Refined color grading tools to perfect your output.
  • Macro system - Simultaneous modulation of different parameters, with filters to affect the output signal. Each export can be enabled or disabled. Macros can be controlled by MIDI.
  • Camera viewport - Camera viewport allow for camera adjustments and scene adjustments while VJ-ing live.

docs.title: Planned features
docs.text:
• Saving/loading projects
  • Saving/loading effect presets on the go
  • Fully mappable MIDI interface
  • More integrated and configurable audio analysis
  • More control over compositing & programming clips
  • General optimisations
  • Set automatable cue points for videos
  • BPM Sync / envelopes
  • VRAM optimisation (somehow...)

I wanted to include this image because I thought it was funny

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Equinox is a sole developer project by me (unami). I'm a 15 year-old student and TouchDesigner artist, and a creative artist for PAREIDOLIA. To support our work, consider testing our software!

Equinox was developed for PAREIDOLIA, a nightclub host delivering audioreactive, synthetic visuals and raising humanitarian aid for MAP and Gazan soup kitchens. You can view our works here!

docs.title: Compositing
docs.text:
The compositor blends multiple layers of media, such as videos and graphics, into one final output. Compositing is used for programmable visual effects and overlaying graphics. Each layer is blended with the previous layer.

The compositor, with 4 layers and multiple clips loaded.

docs.title: Layers
docs.text: A layer is a collection of compiled clips, where each layer plays one clip. Layers are equipped with their own effects chain, where effects can be applied onto the layer before blending.

docs.title: Adding clips
docs.text: To add clips, simply drag a file from a file explorer into an empty clip slot. To remove the clip, hover over the clip slot and click the "X" on the top-right.

docs.title: Mixing
docs.text:
• B — Bypasses the layer from composition.
  • S — Solos the layer, bypassing all other layers from composition.
  • X — Removes the clip and any effects in its FX chain.

The alpha slider controls the alpha of the clip.

docs.title: Blend mode
docs.text: You can customize how layers are overlayed by changing the blend mode. The blend mode determines how layers are overlayed with each other.

docs.title: Playback controls
docs.text:
The play and pause buttons, you guessed it, plays and pauses the clip.

The speed slider adjusts the speed.

The skip buttons transverse through the layer's clips. By default, it skips over empty clip slots.

The bottom slider shows the clip progress.

docs.title: Clip manager
docs.text: On the lower deck of the VJ, next to the effects library, is the clip manager. The clip manager has configurations for playback, transform and the effects chain.

docs.title: Playback
docs.text:
• Blend mode - Control blend mode
  • Speed - Adjust speed of clip
  • Trim start - How much of the clip is cut at the beginning
  • Trim end - How much of the clip is cut at the end

docs.title: Transform
docs.text:
• Translate X - Translation in the x-axis
  • Translate Y - Translation in the y-axis
  • Rotation - Degree of rotation, in degrees
  • Scale - Degree of scale

docs.title: Cue points
docs.text: TBA

docs.title: Effects chain
docs.text:
Each layer has its own effects chain, where different effects can be applied onto a layer. Effects are processed before the layer is composited.

To add effects onto an FX chain, navigate to the effects library and drag the effect onto the FX chain.

Look at this cool kalediscope!

docs.title: Effects
docs.text:
Effects are post-production tools that are designed to manipulate visuals in real-time. Effects apply filters or enhancements to change the way an image is represented.

A frame of Bad Apple, with ASCII and Chromatic Abberation applied.

docs.title: Master effects chain
docs.text:
The master effects chain is the main effects pipeline of your project. Parameterized effects can be added onto the pipeline, where you can edit the video to how you wish. Effects can be rearranged, customized, and automated.

The master effect chain with listed effects.

docs.title: Effects library
docs.text: The effects library is a collection of effects that can be applied to media. It is located on the right side of the bottom deck of the VJ.

docs.title: Adding effects
docs.text: To add an effect, navigate to the effects library (bottom-right panel), and drag your desired effect to the effects chain. The effect will be immediately applied, and you can customize it by clicking on the chevron to drop down its parameters.

docs.title: Controls
docs.text:
From left to right:

  • Dry/wet slider - Adjusts the ratio between the dry (unprocessed) and wet (processed) signal.
  • Options - Open options for effect
  • Lock - Disables editing of the effect.
  • Eye - Toggle whether the effect is active. Turn off to disable cooking.
  • X - Delete the effect from the FX chain.

docs.title: Adding custom effects
docs.text:
All effects are stored in the '/effects' directory as Components. Each effect has its cooking set to false, as to not consume resources in the background. Effect cooking is automatically turned on once applied to an effects chain.

To be recognised as an effect, it must have the operator tag 'effect', and the effect's input and output must be of a TOP type. You can copy an effects template from the '/templates/' folder.

docs.title: Exports
docs.text: yeah

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the latest files from Patreon. (available for Patreon subscribers)

  2. Extract the contents of the folder.

  3. Inside the folder, run VJ.toe.

Congratulations, you are now running the VJ!

docs.title: Macros
docs.text: The macro system is a collection of controllers that output a signal. Macros can be programmed to modulate multiple effects and parameters simultaneously, on command.

docs.title: Triggers
docs.text: Triggers are macros that have an on/off state. There are two types of triggers: momentary and toggle.

docs.title: Knobs & Sliders
docs.text: Knobs and sliders are used for fine control of parameters.

docs.title: Adding macro exports
docs.text:
To add a parameter for a macro to export to, drag the parameter onto the macro. The macro will export its signal to the parameter.

To configure a macro's exports, right-click on the macro and select 'View exports'. A window will open, showing all the macro's exports. You can enable, disable or delete them.

docs.title: Configuring macros
docs.text: To configure macros, right-click on the macro and select 'Macro options'. This will bring up a menu of parameters for the macro.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• Name - Name of macro
  • Color - Adjust hue of macro
  • Min - Clamp min value

docs.title: Scenes
docs.text: Equinox uses Derivative's Scene Changer to handle scenes.

docs.title: Adding scenes
docs.text:
Navigate to the explorer on the bottom deck and select the 'Scenes' tab.

Select 'Import scene .tox'. From the opened file explorer, select your scene. Your scene will be imported into the VJ.

docs.title: Deleting scenes
docs.text: Navigate to the explorer and hover over the scene you wish to delete. Click on the 'X' button on the right side of the container.

docs.title: User interface
docs.text: Equinox implements a traditional VJ user interface to allow for the ease of real-time VJ-ing in TouchDesigner.

docs.title: Pipeline
docs.text:
Equinox implements a five-stage pipeline to generate real-time visual output. Equinox utilises Derivative's built-in Scene Changer from the pallette to handle scenes. All scenes are stored in the '/scenes' directory. The scene's output is routed to the Scene Changer at the start of the pipeline.

graph LR
  A[Scene] --> B;
  B[Compositing] --> C;
  C[Master FX chain] --> D;
  D[Grading] --> E;
  E[Output];

docs.title: FX Stages
docs.text: 1. Scene - Final video corrections and color grading  2. Compositing - Media is mixed in with the source signal.  3. Master FX chain - Pipeline of effects that manipulate the signal  4. Grading - Final video corrections and color grading  5. Output - Final video corrections and color grading
